# Kingston Road railway station

| events              = Opened
| years1              =
| events1             = Closed
}}
Kingston Road railway station served the village of Kingston Seymour, Somerset, England, from 1897 to 1940 on the Weston, Clevedon and Portishead Railway.
History
The station opened on 1 December 1897 by the Weston, Clevedon and Portishead Railway. To the opposite of the shelter was a milk platform but it was removed in the 1930s. The station closed on 20 May 1940.
